DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to compare the efficacy of 0.05 mg and 0.1 mg spinal morphine in reducing postoperative morphine requirement in patients undergoing vaginal hysterectomy with/without anterior and posterior vaginoplasty.
DOC.brief_title: 0.05 Versus 0.1 mg Spinal Morphine for Reducing Morphine Requirement After Vaginal Hysterectomy
DOC.criteria: Female ASA physical status 13 Undergoing vaginal hysterectomy with/without anterior and posterior vaginoplasty Be able to operate patientcontrolled analgesia (PCA) Allergy to the study drugs History of bleeding tendency Infection at the back Refuse to spinal anesthesia History of CAD or CVA
